introduction: The Advanced Mechanics Virtual Lab in the Physical Sciences discipline provides an immersive, interactive platform for studying the mechanical properties of materials and the dynamics of oscillatory systems. This virtual environment allows learners to conduct precision-based experiments related to elasticity, torsion, and pendulum motion—without the limitations of physical equipment. Through simulated instrumentation and detailed data analysis tools, students gain practical insights into concepts such as Young’s modulus, rigidity modulus, moment of inertia, and simple harmonic motion. The lab bridges the gap between theory and experimentation, fostering a deeper understanding of advanced mechanics through safe, repeatable, and accessible virtual experiments.

experiments.name: Rigidity Modulus of The Suspension Wire of A Torsion Pendulum
Moment of inertia of a Torsion Pendulum

UG: B.Sc. Physics, B.Tech./B.E. (EEE, ECE, Mechanical, Civil)
PG: MS/Ph. D. Beginners in Physical Science

objective:
The objectives of the Advanced Mechanics Virtual Lab (Physical Sciences) are:
  • To determine the rigidity modulus of various materials using torsion pendulum and static torsion methods.
  • To evaluate Young’s modulus through uniform and non-uniform bending experiments using standard measurement techniques.
  • To understand and analyze the behavior of a compound pendulum, including symmetric designs and Kater’s pendulum, for accurate measurement of gravitational acceleration.
  • To investigate torsional oscillations and their dependence on moment of inertia and restoring torque.
  • To enhance conceptual clarity and experimental skills related to elasticity and oscillatory motion through visual simulation and data interpretation.
  • To encourage inquiry-based learning by allowing students to manipulate experimental conditions and observe the resulting effects in real-time.
